channel.title: full of grace and truth » sermons
channel.description:
Anglican minister. Committed, under God, to building healthy local churches through short-term transitional ministry. Trained in Intentional Interim Ministry.
This podcast provides a practical means of making my talks (sermons) available to those who might hear God speak through them. That could be anyone. But most of the time, my primary ‘target audience’ is the congregation of whichever church I’m presently serving.
My passion is to preach Christ from all of Scripture. Should you wish to listen, I invite your reflection (and comments if you wish) as to whether the words you hear bear His character. Are they, like him, “full of grace and truth”? (John 1:14)

image.title: full of grace and truth » sermons

channel.itunes:subtitle: Lance Lawton's sermons
channel.itunes:summary:
Anglican minister. Committed, under God, to building healthy local churches through short-term transitional ministry. Trained in Intentional Interim Ministry.
This podcast provides a practical means of making my talks (sermons) available to those who might hear God speak through them. That could be anyone. But most of the time, my primary ‘target audience’ is the congregation of whichever church I’m presently serving.
My passion is to preach Christ from all of Scripture. Should you wish to listen, I invite your reflection (and comments if you wish) as to whether the words you hear bear His character. Are they, like him, “full of grace and truth”? (John 1:14)

item.title: From bad to worse
item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: The further people drift from fellowship with God, the further they drift from one another, and from life and all that life was meant to be in the Creator’s loving plan. So begins a pattern of sin and judgement … … Continue reading →
item.itunes:subtitle: The further people drift from fellowship with God, the further they drift from one another, and from life and all that life was meant to be in the Creator’s loving plan. So begins a pattern of sin and judgement … but the last word is alw[...]
item.itunes:summary: The further people drift from fellowship with God, the further they drift from one another, and from life and all that life was meant to be in the Creator’s loving plan. So begins a pattern of sin and judgement … but the last word is always grace.
item.itunes:author: Lance Lawton

item.title: The perfect match
item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: Loving relationships and companionship are at the core of God’s intention for all human beings, and should be experienced in the Church like nowhere else on earth.

item.title: The perfect job
item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: The core of being human is bearing God’s image and doing God’s work in God’s world. This work in itself is of the essence of being human.

item.title: The splintered throne
item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: Despite appearances of defeat and death, the Cross of Jesus testifies to his royal rule. As King, he has the power to deliver on his offer to restore to God’s paradise, anyone who turns to him.

item.title: Why aren’t you crying?
item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: Palm Sunday We readily and rightly praise Jesus, God’s King. But are we ready and willing to weep with him for our lost city?

item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: You could be lonely because your life is unbalanced or because you’re unrewarded. The real solution to loneliness is the friendship of Christ.

item.title: All the lonely people – Pt I
item.dc:creator: Lance Lawton
item.description: Loneliness is very common and very sad, because it’s so far short of what God always intended for humanity. You could be lonely because you’re a powerless victim of injustice, or because the rat-race of life has killed your spirit.
